Sentencas: Direct carbon fuel cells (DCFCs) have recently attracted great interest because they could provide a considerably more efficient means of power generation in comparison with conventional coal-fired power plants.
Titulo: A performance study of hybrid direct carbon fuel cells: Impact of anode microstructure

Sentencas: Among various types of DCFCs under development, a hybrid system offers the combined advantages of solid oxide and molten carbonate electrolytes; however, there is a significant technical challenge in terms of power capability.
Titulo: A performance study of hybrid direct carbon fuel cells: Impact of anode microstructure

Sentencas: Here, we report an experimental study demonstrating how anode microstructure influences the power-generating characteristics of hybrid DCFCs.
Titulo: A performance study of hybrid direct carbon fuel cells: Impact of anode microstructure

Sentencas: The anode microstructure (pore volume and surface area) is modified by using poly(methyl methacrylate) (PMMA) pore-formers.
Titulo: A performance study of hybrid direct carbon fuel cells: Impact of anode microstructure

Sentencas: Polarization studies indicate that cell performance is strongly dependent on the anode surface area rather than on the pore volume.
Titulo: A performance study of hybrid direct carbon fuel cells: Impact of anode microstructure

Sentencas: The incorporation of PMMA-derived pores into the anode leads to improved power capability at typical operating temperatures, which is attributed to an enlarged active zone for electrochemical CO oxidation.
Titulo: A performance study of hybrid direct carbon fuel cells: Impact of anode microstructure
